message.content:
cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.RO 

The paper proposes a novel architecture that combines Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) and Graph Neural Networks (GNN) to solve routing optimization problems in networking. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also discusses the limitations of existing DRL-based networking techniques and proposes a solution that can generalize over arbitrary network topologies, which suggests that it could also be relevant to the sub-categories cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.RO (Robotics).
